node.title: 'No hope': Afghan girls in tears over Taliban U-turn on schools
node.description: Girls were in shock after high schools were abruptly shut after re-opening for the first time in months.

node.title: Man pleads guilty in 2014 killing of N.J. political operative
node.description: Another political consultant, Sean Caddle, allegedly ordered the hit but didn't explain why he wanted his onetime friend dead.

node.title: Thorn Financial Services to merge with Limelight Software
node.description: The merged company will be called Limelight Group and provide integrated software, finance and finance-associated services directly to customers and Limelight's vehicle dealerships channel.

node.title: 'Scary and freaky': Tolaga Bay resident describes wild weather in Gisborne
node.description: MetService says although there are weather warnings in place and heavy rain forecast for Tairāwhiti, it is not the "wettest March" on record for the region. Audio

node.title: Watch Live: Biden holds press conference in Brussels after NATO summit
node.description: President Biden has been meeting with European allies about Russia's war on Ukraine.

node.title: Prices for used Teslas jump 6% in just two weeks
node.description: The average price of a used Tesla is now $65,000. New models see price jumps, too, with a Tesla Model X costing $115,000.

node.title: Double lung transplant saves Chicago man with terminal cancer
node.description: Six months after Albert Khoury's surgery, the lungs are working well and he has no signs of cancer in his body.

node.title: Tennis: World number one Ash Barty retires
node.description: Australia's world number one Ash Barty has decided to retire from professional tennis at the age of 25.

node.title: Troy Kingi wins Silver Scroll for 'All Your Ships Have Sailed'
node.description: Watch a special performance of Troy Kingi's 'All Your Ships Have Sailed' recorded by Deva Mahal with a band of nine wāhine toa, after the tune won the Silver Scroll Award earlier tonight. Video

node.title: Anti-social behaviour no 'excuse' to stop public housing builds - Minister
node.description: The government says it "can build a good community" on Rotorua's Tania Crescent.

node.title: West should do more before "Putin kills a million people," McMaster says
node.description: If Russian forces continue to bombard population centers in Ukraine, they could kill a million people, said former White House national security adviser H.R. McMaster.

node.title: Iowa teens used baseball bat to kill Spanish teacher, police say
node.description: The documents say a witness told police the items used or worn during the crime were taken to one teen's home.

node.title: MacKenzie Scott donates $3.8 billion to 465 charities
node.description: Gifts from the former wife of Amazon.com founder Jeff Bezos include a record $275 million donation to Planned Parenthood.

node.title: Supreme Court rules for Texas death row inmate in religious rights case
node.description: The court ruled 8-1, with Justice Clarence Thomas as the lone dissenter.

node.title: U.S. launches deportation operation to Colombia using Title 42 border rule
node.description: The expulsions have been carried out under Title 42, a pandemic border restriction first implemented by the Trump administration.

node.title: Tom Hanks officiates Pittsburgh couple's wedding
node.description: The bride revealed how she got Hanks to come to her house for her wedding.

node.title: More artists added to Grammys lineup
node.description: The show, hosted by Trevor Noah, will air on CBS on Sunday, April 3 at 8:00 p.m. ET.

node.title: Why the South gets more killer tornadoes at night
node.description: Tornadoes are causing more deaths and destruction in the Southeast — and they're often doing it in the dark of night.

node.title: Russian journalist Oksana Baulina killed in Kyiv shelling
node.description: The Insider says Baulina, who had previously worked for Putin foe Alexey Navalny, "died under fire" in the Ukrainian capital.

node.title: Rent, heat, gas: Americans face inflation triple whammy
node.description: The cost of housing, heating and transportation is reaching record highs, squeezing renters on all sides.

node.title: Bill Clinton on why Ukraine was on Madeleine Albright's mind before her death
node.description: Madeleine Albright was the 64th U.S. secretary of state and the first woman to ever serve in the role.

node.title: Ukraine says Russian ship destroyed as cost of Putin's war spirals
node.description: NATO says as many as 15,000 Russian troops may have been killed in a month of war, but with Putin's forces bogged down, it's Ukrainian civilians paying the highest price.

node.title: Remains of U.S. pilot killed in WWII identified, with help from daughter
node.description: "I've always wondered more about my father," said Linda Shauvin, who was just 3 years old when her father left for the war and never returned.

node.title: Jobless claims fall to 50-year low amid tight labor market
node.description: Just 187,000 people applied for unemployment benefits last week, a sign the job market remains tight.

node.title: U.S. plans to receive 100,000 Ukrainians displaced by Russian invasion
node.description: The announcement comes as President Biden is in Brussels meeting with NATO and EU allies.

node.title: More than half of Ukraine's kids displaced by Russia's war, U.N. says
node.description: "This is a grim milestone that could have lasting consequences for generations to come," said the executive director of UNICEF.

node.title: Watch Live: Outside witnesses testify on final day of Jackson hearings
node.description: Republicans continued lines of questioning on Wednesday regarding Jackson's handling of child pornography cases during her time as a federal judge.

node.title: U.S. to start asylum overhaul plan in the late spring
node.description: The administration hopes the changes will drastically reduce the amount of time asylum-seekers wait for their claims to be decided while cutting down the backlog of cases.

node.title: Gov. Whitmer kidnapping would be "ignition" for civil war, witness says
node.description: "We wanted to cause as much a disruption as possible to prevent Joe Biden from getting into office," Ty Garbin told jurors.

node.title: Iconic bull elk found dead in Rocky Mountain National Park
node.description: Loren Schrag, who found the animal's carcass, said he believes it was killed by a mountain lion.
